meanings.definition: Talk at length in a foolish or inconsequential way.
meanings.sent1: Children often prattle about their toys endlessly.
meanings.sent2: She tends to prattle on about her day without pausing.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to prattle along with the chatty children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would prattle like a broken record, repeating the same thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The stream seemed to prattle on as it flowed over the rocks.

meanings.definition: The action or sound of talking in a foolish or inconsequential way.
meanings.sent1: The constant prattle of the students filled the classroom.
meanings.sent2: His speech was nothing but mindless prattle.
meanings.sent3: The prattle of the birds in the morning brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The prattle of the old radio in the background was oddly comforting.
meanings.sent5: The prattle of the brook was a soothing lullaby to the weary traveler.
